parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.46</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>


____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns marker position. See also [[setMarkerPos]]. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[markerPos]] markerName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - format [x, y, '''0'''] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[markerPos]] [markerName, preserveElevation] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;''(Since Arma 3 v1.93)''</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [markerName, preserveElevation]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> preserveElevation: [[Boolean]] (Optional, default [[false]]) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] - format [[PositionAGL]] if ''preserveElevation'' is [[true]] or [x, y, '''0'''] if ''preserveElevation'' is [[false]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_mPos1 = [[markerPos]] "markerOne";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_mPos2 = [[markerPos]] ["markerTwo", [[true]]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setMarkerPos]], [[setMarkerPosLocal]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 1, 2016 - 12:42 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Demellion|Demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To acomplish getting the altitude of a marker before the alternative syntax introduced in A3 v1.93, you can do a workaround using [[setMarkerDir]] as it accepts any number (above 360 or below -360):
<code>"myMarker" [[setMarkerPos]] [200, 200];
"myMarker" [[setMarkerDir]] 1640;</code>

After, setting player position as an example:
<code>[[player]] [[setPosASL]] [([[markerPos]] "myMarker") [[select]] 0, ([[markerPos]] "myMarker") [[select]] 1, ([[markerDir]] "myMarker")]</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
